subject.geographic: On the corner of Thalia and Bacchus streets
On the corner of Thalia and Bacchus streets

mods.abstract: TWENTY DOLLARS REWARD.--Ran away or was stolen from the subscriber, residing at the corner of Thalia and Bacchus streets, on the 30th ult., the Negro Boy GEORGE, black, about 18 years old; has on when he left a black cloth cap, green pants and blue plaid worsted round jacket. The above re-ward will be paid by the subscriber, upon his delivery, and thirty dollars in addition if sufficient evidence is furnished to convict the thief. [ap7 d&w4t] WM. P. GRAYSON.
mods.accessCondition: Please submit an LSU Special Collections reference ticket at https://askus.lib.lsu.edu/special for any questions or comments about this digital object.

Physical rights are retained by the LSU Libraries. Copyright has expired and the item is therefore in the public domain. Permission to reproduce this image must be requested through the Special Collections Department, Louisiana State University Libraries.
mods.note: Louisiana Runaway Slave Advertisements, 1836-1865, Louisiana Digital Library, Baton Rouge, La.
